The best way to protect yourself is to take care when applying for positions. Related: Scam Alert: Fake Job Recruiters Tried to Catfish Us, Here’s What Happened
The Best Tech Newsletter Around
By subscribing, you agree to our Privacy Policy and may receive occasional deal communications; you can unsubscribe anytime.
 How to Spot a Recruitment Scam
You can take the usual precautions to spot similar scams if you're concerned about a potential job listing or offer. You'll be told to transfer money via a service like Western Union, or you'll be guided to a fake web page to make your payment.
 Some employers may require you to purchase a uniform or similar, but you shouldn't do this until your contract has been signed and you have met face to face.
